questions.questionTitle: Reading - Part 3 - Topic : Plans for a new station
questions.content:
Topic: Plans for a new station


*Đoạn văn của 4 người:

Yulan: The city planners say that there is a need to build a new station. Personally, I don’t see the need for it. I don't use the trains regularly, but when I do, they are always on time. The bus services, which I use to go to the hospital, are just the same. 


Moussa: I take the train to work every day, and I am tired of the overcrowded trains. I can’t even find a seat and have to see many people standing in a very crowded place. The buses are no better. I think the new station will make a big difference. 


Liam: The city planners promised money for building a hospital. Now they say that they need to build a new station that will improve the whole city's traffic. I don’t understand. It may require the whole annual budget and leave no money to invest in health facilities. Personally, I believe there should be more money spent on improving medical services.


Emia: The new station will be in the residential area, close to the hospital and university. We already have buses for getting around, and even though they might be slow sometimes, that’s not a reason for not punctuation. I always go to work on time, even in the high time in morning, as I always work on my schedule. I think people should do the same.

questions.questionTitle: Reading - Part 3 - Topic : CỦA ĐỀ HOTEL ( chưa rõ tên Topic )
questions.content:
Topic : Technology 

Đoạn văn 4 người 

A : "I moved to a new country, and it is challenging to stay in touch with relatives, but thanks to technology, I can now easily contact my family. I rely on technology a lot for this reason, and I believe many people nowadays depend on it too. It makes sense, and I have no issues with that. Technology has made staying connected much more convenient and accessible for all of us."


B : "I work in finance, and it is normal for me to use technology to update international banking information, as I am an accountant. However, looking at the screen for too long makes my eyes hurt. Also, using my phone for extended periods before bedtime affects my sleep, so I avoid it after 9 p.m. to ensure a good night's rest."


C : "Our family uses technology a lot. My sister called Mom even inside the house! Although my dad told us not to use the phone at night, I use it anyway. I find it convenient to watch movies and listen to music. I also use it to play games with friends. My friends always have the most updated games, which puts pressure on me to buy the latest as soon as I can. I don’t want to lag behind them."


D : "I am a professional painter, which is not traditionally connected to technology, but perhaps I will use it more in the future. I have a laptop at home. Whenever I use it, my daughter becomes really interested, so I have to keep it locked away. Although some of my friends are keen on letting children be exposed to technology, I think it would have an effect on their brain development."

questions.content:
Topic : Film

 Person A: A friend recommended the film because she had read the novel. I thought it was excellent, and I was captivated by the plot throughout, even though it was quite lengthy. All of the actors were outstanding, and the scenes where the zombies were finally defeated were amazing. The only thing I didn’t like was my choice of viewing location. I should have gone out—it would have been much better on the big screen.

Person B: This was a sequel, and I hadn’t seen the prior film, so I have to admit I felt completely lost. I’m pleased I had company. Luckily, my friend was able to explain who the characters were. There were some aspects I liked—the special effects, for example, were impressive, and the soundtrack was lovely. I would definitely recommend it to people who enjoy feeling scared, but personally, films like this don’t frighten me. I think I’ll stick to romantic movies in the future.

Person C: Unfortunately, it wasn’t as good as I expected. The written version was terrifying but also thrilling. However, I ended up feeling bored while watching the film. The acting was rather uninspiring, and two and a half hours was excessive. I reckon the story could have been told in half the time. It was definitely better on the page than on the screen. Furthermore, cinema tickets are so costly these days. To be honest, I wish I hadn’t wasted my money!

Person D: This was actually my second time watching it, but even though I knew what to expect, I still felt scared whenever a zombie attack happened. The direction really makes it feel like you are right there in the room with the characters. Being familiar with the film didn’t make it easier! I was so relieved when my friend called after I got home so that I could chat about ordinary things and forget about it. Otherwise, I might have had nightmares! ​

tienphongSpace
questions.suggestion:
Who thought the film was too long?

  • Person C
  • Giải thích: Person C nói: "two and a half hours was excessive." (hai tiếng rưỡi là quá dài).
  • Person A cũng nhắc đến việc bộ phim dài ("even though it was quite lengthy."), nhưng họ không phàn nàn về điều đó. Họ vẫn thấy phim "excellent" (tuyệt vời) và bị cuốn hút vào cốt truyện suốt thời gian xem.

Trong khi đó, Person C không chỉ nói phim dài mà còn chỉ trích điều đó:

  • "two and a half hours was excessive." (hai tiếng rưỡi là quá dài).
  • "The story could have been told in half the time." (Câu chuyện có thể được kể trong nửa thời gian đó).
  • Vì vậy, câu trả lời chính xác là Person C, vì họ thực sự thấy bộ phim quá dài đến mức không hài lòng về nó.

Who saw the film previously?

  • Person D
  • Giải thích: Person D nói: "This was actually my second time watching it." (Đây thực sự là lần thứ hai tôi xem nó).

Who watched the film at home?

  • Person A
  • Giải thích: Person A nói: "I should have gone out—it would have been much better on the big screen." (Tôi nên ra ngoài – nó sẽ hay hơn nhiều trên màn ảnh rộng), chứng tỏ họ đã xem ở nhà.

Who has read the book about the film?

  • Person C
  • Giải thích: Person C nói: "The written version was terrifying but also thrilling." (Bản viết rất đáng sợ nhưng cũng hồi hộp), cho thấy họ đã đọc sách.

Who liked the story of the film?

  • Person A

Who found the film scary?

  • Person D
  • Giải thích: Person D nói: "I still felt scared whenever a zombie attack happened." (Tôi vẫn cảm thấy sợ mỗi khi một cuộc tấn công zombie xảy ra).

Who saw the film with a friend?

  • Person B
  • Giải thích: Person B nói: "I’m pleased I had company. Luckily, my friend was able to explain who the characters were." (Tôi rất vui vì có người đi cùng).

“Chủ đề: Trung tâm lịch sử tự nhiên  

- Quan trọng nhất trong số này là Trung tâm Lịch sử Tự nhiên - Lối vào trung tâm nằm trên quảng trường chính của thị trấn. - Khi bạn vào tòa nhà từ quảng trường, bạn sẽ thấy một dãy cầu thang ở bên trái - Phòng bán vé nằm trên đầu những cầu thang này, nhân viên ở đó rất hữu ích. - Ngoài việc bán vé, họ còn có thể cung cấp bản đồ và thông tin du lịch hữu ích"



Natural History centre, NẰM TRÊN QUẢNG TRƯỜNG CHÍNH (the town’s main square), đi bằng CẦU THANG BÊN TRÁI (set of stairs to your left) để tới PHÒNG BÁN VÉ (The ticket office), Nhân viên sẽ BÁN VÉ, CUNG CÁP BẢN ĐỒ (selling tickets, the staff provides maps)

questions.questionTitle: Reading - Part 2 - Topic : Instructions for new students
questions.content:
Topic : Instructions for new students

tienphongSpace CÂU ĐẦU CỐ ĐỊNH

answerList.content: When you arrive at the college, go to the help desk
You will find these in material links on your home page
You can use this card to borrow books from library and access lesson materials online
He or she will enter your information into the computer and give you an identification card
A member of staff will ask for your name and your address

questions.suggestion:
Topic : Instructions for new students

- When you arrive at the college, go to the help desk

- A member of staff will ask for your name and your address

- He or she will enter your information into the computer and give you an identification card

- You can use this card to borrow books from library and access lesson materials online

- You will find these in material links on your home page

DỊCH :

“Chủ đề: Hướng dẫn cho học viên mới 

- Khi đến trường đại học, hãy đến bàn trợ giúp 

- Nhân viên sẽ hỏi tên và địa chỉ của bạn 

- Người đó sẽ nhập thông tin của bạn vào máy tính và đưa cho bạn chứng minh nhân dân 

- Bạn có thể sử dụng thẻ này để mượn sách từ thư viện và truy cập tài liệu bài học trực tuyến 

- Bạn sẽ tìm thấy những điều này trong các liên kết tài liệu trên trang chủ của bạn"


KHI BẠN ĐẾN TRƯỜNG (When you arrive at the university), NHÂN VIÊN SẼ HỎI TÊN VÀ ĐỊA CHỈ CỦA BẠN (A member of staff will ask for your name and your address) rồi NHẬP THÔNG TIN VÀO MÁY TÍNH (will enter your information into the computer). BẠN CÓ THỂ SỬ DỤNG THẺ () để TÌM TÀI LIỆU (find....material )

questions.content:
Topic: key card

tienphongSpace CÂU ĐẦU CỐ ĐỊNH

answerList.content: - He or she will ask for your name and your flat numer, and then will write these down
- If you lose this, you will need to see the staff member at the front desk
- He or she will make a copy of it and give you a new key card
- To enter the building and use the lift, you will need your key card
- You will also need to show you identification card

questions.suggestion:
Topic: key card

- To access the building and use the lift, you need to use the key card

- If you lose this, please see the staff member at the front desk

- He or she will ask your name and flat number and will note this down

- You will also need to show him or her your identification card

- He or she will take a copy of it and give you a new card


DỊCH :

"Chủ đề: thẻ chìa khóa 

- Để vào tòa nhà và sử dụng thang máy, bạn sẽ cần có thẻ chìa khóa

- Nếu làm mất cái này, bạn sẽ phải gặp nhân viên ở quầy lễ tân

- Anh ấy hoặc cô ấy sẽ hỏi tên và số phẳng của bạn, sau đó sẽ viết chúng ra

- Bạn cũng sẽ cần xuất trình thẻ căn cước

- Anh ấy hoặc cô ấy sẽ sao chép nó và đưa cho bạn một thẻ chìa khóa mới"


ĐỂ VÀO TÒA NHÀ (To access the building), bạn cần gặp NHÂN VIÊN (the staff). HE OR SHE SẼ HỎI TÊN VÀ SỐ PHÒNG (He or she will ask for your name and your flat numer) rồi BẠN SẼ XUẤT TRÌNH THẺ CĂN CƯỚC (show you identification card) =>>> ĐƯA CHÌA KHÓA CHO BẠN (new key card)

questions.questionTitle: Reading - Part 2 - Topic : Buying a new house
questions.content:
Topic : Buying a new house

tienphongSpace CÂU ĐẦU CỐ ĐỊNH

answerList.content: In order to choose the right place, you need to consider several factors
The most important of these to look at is the price of homes
The first and most important thing is to choose the location
Other factors to look at is the place of employment, shops and schools
Such requirements of course depend on you personal circumstances

questions.suggestion:
2.1. Topic : Buying a new house

- The first and most important thing is to choose the location

- In order to choose the right place, you need to consider several factors

- The most important of these to look at is the price of homes

- Other factors to look at is the place of employment, shops and schools

- Such requirements of course depend on you personal circumstances


DỊCH :

Chủ đề: Mua nhà mới 

- Điều đầu tiên và quan trọng nhất là chọn vị trí 

- Để chọn được nơi phù hợp, bạn cần cân nhắc nhiều yếu tố 

- Điều quan trọng nhất cần xem xét là giá nhà 

- Các yếu tố khác cần xem xét là nơi làm việc, cửa hàng và trường học 

- Những yêu cầu như vậy tất nhiên tùy thuộc vào hoàn cảnh cá nhân của bạn


CHỌN ĐỊA ĐIỂM (choose the location ) CẦN CÂN NHẮC 1 SÓ YẾU TỐ (need to consider several factors) :

1. GIÁ NHÀ (the price of homes)

2. Tiện ích ở xung quang : NƠI LÀM VIỆC, CỬA HÀNG, TRƯỜNG HỌC (the place of employment, shops and schools )

Đương nhiên vẫn cần phụ thuộc vào HOÀN CẢNH CÁ NHÂN CỦA BẠN (you personal circumstances)

questions.questionTitle: Reading - Part 2 - Topic : Using public bicycle
questions.content:
Topic : Renting a bike 

tienphongSpace CÂU ĐẦU CỐ ĐỊNH

answerList.content: Choose “Hire the cycle”, and follow the instructions to get your release code.
At the end of your ride, return the bike at any collection point.
Go to the collection point and touch the screen with your bank card.
When the light shows, you can unlock the bike and start your journey.
Enter your code in the lock on the bike and wait for the light green.

questions.suggestion:
Topic : Renting a bike 

- Go to the collection point and touch the screen with your bank card.

- Choose “Hire the cycle”, and follow the instructions to get your release code.

- Enter your code in the lock on the bike and wait for the light green.

- When the light shows, you can unlock the bike and start your journey.

- At the end of your ride, return the bike at any collection point.


DỊCH :

Chủ đề : Sử dụng xe đạp công cộng 

- Đến điểm thu tiền và bấm vào màn hình để chọn xe bằng thẻ ngân hàng của bạn 

- Trên màn hình chọn “thuê chu kỳ” rồi làm theo hướng dẫn để nhận mã mở khóa. 

- Nhập mã số vào ổ khóa xe và đợi đèn xanh 

- Khi đèn bật sáng, bạn có thể mở khóa xe đạp và bắt đầu hành trình 

- Khi kết thúc hành trình, hãy trả xe về bất kỳ điểm thu gom nào còn trống


ĐẾN ĐIỂM NHẬN XE (Go to the collection point) CHỌN THUÊ XE ĐẠP (Choose “Hire the cycle”), NHẬP MÃ VÀO Ở KHÓA (Enter your code in the lock). KHI ĐÈN SÁNG, BẠN CÓ THỂ BẮT ĐẦU CHUYẾN ĐI (When the light shows ... start your journey.). KẾT THÚC CHUYẾN ĐI (At the end of your ride) hãy trả xe tại bất kỳ điểm nhận xe nào

questions.questionTitle: Reading - Part 2 - Topic : My first car
questions.content:
Topic : My first car

tienphongSpace CÂU ĐẦU CỐ ĐỊNH

answerList.content: I called the number on the advert to get more information about it.
We agreed on a price that was reasonable for both after a short negotiation.
However, I didn’t have a car, so I started searching for one immediately.
So, when I saw an advertisement for a used car, I was interested.
I had just passed my test and was excited to begin driving soon.

questions.suggestion:
Topic : My first car

- I had just passed my test and was excited to begin driving soon.

- However, I didn’t have a car, so I started searching for one immediately.

- So, when I saw an advertisement for a used car, I was interested.

- I called the number on the advert to get more information about it.

- We agreed on a price that was reasonable for both after a short negotiation.


DỊCH :

"Chủ đề: Chiếc xe đầu tiên của tôi 

- Tôi vừa vượt qua bài kiểm tra và tôi tự hào sở hữu bằng lái xe 

- Tuy nhiên, tôi không có ô tô và bố mẹ tôi không cho tôi lái xe của họ 

- Vì vậy, khi tôi nhìn thấy một quảng cáo trên báo địa phương về một chiếc xe cũ giá rẻ, tôi đã không lãng phí một phút nào 

- Tôi đã gọi đến số trong quảng cáo đó và hẹn gặp người chủ ở phía bên kia thị trấn 

- Chúng tôi đã thỏa thuận giá cả và khi tôi giao tiền, anh ấy đưa chìa khóa cho tôi.”


TÔI ĐÃ VƯỢT QUA KỲ THI (passed my test ) nhưng TÔI KHÔNG CÓ XE (didn’t have a car). Khi TÔI THẤY MỘT QUẢNG CÁO VỀ 1 XE CŨ (a used car) thì đã GỌI ĐIỆN (called) để hỏi thông tin về nó. CHÚNG TÔI ĐÃ ĐỒNG Ý 1 MỨC GIÁ HỢP LÝ (agreed on a price that was reasonable)

questions.content:
Topic : Life of the Great Belly

tienphongSpace CÂU ĐẦU CỐ ĐỊNH

answerList.content: At that time, Shanghai was a city filled with many people from different countries.
However, Belly missed China and often thought about her homeland.
She was born in Shanghai in 1933 to an American mother from Scotland.
In the 1980s, she finally returned to China and still lives with her Shanghai husband.
A few years after she finished school, she moved abroad.

questions.suggestion:
Topic : Life of the Great Belly

- She was born in Shanghai in 1933 to an American mother from Scotland.

- At that time, Shanghai was a city filled with many people from different countries.

- A few years after she finished school, she moved abroad.

- However, Belly missed China and often thought about her homeland.

- In the 1980s, she finally returned to China and still lives with her Shanghai husband.


DỊCH :

"Chủ đề: Cuộc sống của Great Belly

- Bà sinh ra tại Thượng Hải vào năm 1933 với một người mẹ người Mỹ gốc Scotland.

- Vào thời điểm đó, Thượng Hải là một thành phố đông đúc với nhiều người đến từ nhiều quốc gia khác nhau.

- Vài năm sau khi tốt nghiệp, bà chuyển ra nước ngoài.

- Tuy nhiên, Belly nhớ Trung Quốc và thường nghĩ về quê hương của mình.

- Vào những năm 1980, cuối cùng bà đã trở về Trung Quốc và vẫn sống với người chồng Thượng Hải của mình.

"

SINH RA TẠI THƯỢNG HẢI VÀO NĂM 1933 (born in Shanghai in 1933), lúc đó THƯỢNG HẢI LÀ 1 THÀNH PHỐ ĐÔNG ĐÚC (Shanghai was a city filled). Vài năm sau khi tốt nghiệp, bà CHUYỂN RA NƯỚC NGOÀI (she moved abroad). Tuy nhiên Belly luôn NHỚ VỀ TRUNG QUỐC (missed China). Vào năm 1980, bà ấy TRỞ VỀ TRUNG QUỐC (returned to China

questions.questionTitle: Reading - Part 2 - Topic : Quy trình nộp report
questions.content:
Topic : Quy trình nộp report

tienphongSpace CÂU ĐẦU CỐ ĐỊNH

answerList.content: After making corrections, send your report by email to the college secretary
Before writing, spend a week looking at websites for the information you need
You should also include a list of any books you use for reference
Remember to save the links to those websites and include them in your report
When you have finished writing, read through to correct spelling mistakesWhen you have finished writing, read through to correct spelling mistakes

questions.suggestion:
Topic : Quy trình nộp report

- Before writing, spend a week looking at websites for the information you need

- Remember to save the links to those websites and include them in your report

- You should also include a list of any books you use for reference

- When you have finished writing, read through to correct spelling mistakes

- After making corrections, send your report by email to the college secretary


DỊCH :

"Chủ đề: Quy trình chuẩn báo cáo

- Trước khi viết, hãy dành một tuần để xem các trang web để biết thông tin bạn cần

- Nhớ lưu các liên kết đến các trang web đó và đưa chúng vào báo cáo của bạn

- Bạn cũng nên đưa vào danh sách bất kỳ cuốn sách nào bạn sử dụng để tham khảo

- Khi bạn viết xong, hãy đọc lại để sửa lỗi chính tả

- Sau khi sửa, hãy gửi báo cáo của bạn qua email cho thư ký của trường

"

Quy trình gồm 2 bước

1. TRƯỚC KHI VIẾT (Before writing) hãy dành 1 tuần để xem. Hãy NHỚ LƯU CÁC LIÊN KẾT (save the links), ĐƯA VÀO BẤT KỲ CUỐN SÁCH NÀO SỬ DỤNG THAM KHẢO (any books you use for reference)

2. KHI VIẾT XONG (When you have finished writing) thì đọc lại để sửa lỗi

3. SAU KHI SỬA (After making corrections), gửi báo cáo qua email cho thư ký

questions.questionTitle: Reading - Part 2 - Topic : Quy trình dùng máy in printer
questions.content:
Topic : Quy trình dùng máy in printer

tienphongSpace CÂU ĐẦU CỐ ĐỊNH

answerList.content: - If the light is green, your printer is ready to use
- First, you need to find an appropriate place to put your printer
- Before using the printer, you need to put papers into it.
- A light comes on at the front of the printer
- When your printer is in place, turn it on using the switch

questions.suggestion:
Quy trình dùng máy in printer

- Firstly, find an appropriate place to put the printer in.

- When the printer is in place, turn it on by switching the buttons on the sides.

- A light comes on at the front of the printer when the power is on.

- If the light is green, the printer is ready to use.

- Before using, remember to put some paper into the tray.


DỊCH :

Chủ đề : Quy trình sử dụng máy in 

- Đầu tiên bạn cần tìm một nơi thích hợp để đặt máy in của mình 

- Khi máy in của bạn đã ở đúng vị trí, hãy bật nó lên bằng công tắc 

- Đèn sáng phía trước máy in 

- Nếu đèn xanh nghĩa là máy in của bạn đã sẵn sàng sử dụng 

- Trước khi sử dụng máy in, bạn cần cho giấy tờ vào.


TÌM NƠI THÍCH HỢP ĐỂ ĐẶT MÁY (place to put the printer in), BẬT MÁY (turn it on), ĐÈN SÁNG (A light comes on)khi bật nguồn. NẾU ĐỀN XANH (If the light is green) thì máy đã sẵn sàng để sử dụng. Trước khi sử dụng, CHO 1 ÍT GIẤY VÀO KHAY (put some paper into the tray)

Topic : Albert Einstein

tienphongSpace CÂU ĐẦU CỐ ĐỊNH

answerList.content: - His best friend in his new class was a girl named Lavirme
- These were so advanced that he soon became famous all over the world
- As a child, he moved to a special school because he was so clever

Topic : Albert Einstein

- As a child, he moved to a special school because he was so clever

- His best friend in his new class was a girl named Lavirme

- She later becamne his wife and. helped him with his earliest scientific điscoveries

- These were so advanced that he soon became famous all over the world

- Princeton University in the USA offred. hìm a job because he was so famous

﻿

DỊCH :

"Chủ đề: Albert Einstein

- Khi còn nhỏ, anh ấy đã chuyển đến một trường học đặc biệt vì anh ấy rất thông minh 

- Người bạn thân nhất của cậu ấy ở lớp mới là một cô gái tên là Lavirme 

- Sau này cô ấy đã trở thành vợ anh ấy và. đã giúp đỡ ông với những khám phá khoa học sớm nhất 

- Những thứ này tiến bộ đến mức ông ấy nhanh chóng trở nên nổi tiếng khắp thế giới

- Đại học Princeton ở Mỹ cung cấp. hìm một công việc vì anh ấy quá nổi tiếng"

questions.questionTitle: Reading - Part 2 - Topic : How to plant potatoes
questions.content:
Topic : How to plant potatoes

tienphongSpace CÂU ĐẦU CỐ ĐỊNH

answerList.content: - This colour means it is perfect for growing, you should put some earth in the pot and dig it deep down
- All you need is some earth, an old potato and a big spot
- When you've done this, you should water it everyday and place it in a sunny spot
- With this care, you should see a potato plant growing after couples of weeks
- An old potato will have little roots, will be a little green, and won't be good for eating

questions.suggestion:
Topic : How to plant potatoes

- All you need is some earth, an old potato, and a big spot

- An old potato will have little roots, will be a little green, and won't be good for eating

- This color means it is perfect for growing, you should put some earth in the pot and dig it deep down

- When you've done this, you should water it every day and place it in a sunny spot

- With this care, you should see a potato plant growing after a couple of weeks


DỊCH :

- Tất cả những gì bạn cần là một ít ĐẤT, CHẬU LỚN, KHOAI TÂY CŨ. ( earth, a big pot and some old potatoes )

- Khoai tây cũ có MỘT ÍT RỄ, HƠI XANH (a little root...little green ) và KHÔNG TỐT ĐỂ ĂN (not good for eating)

- Màu đó có nghĩa là nó hoàn hảo để trồng; sau đó bạn ĐÀO HỐ và ĐẶT SÂU XUỐNG (pull a hole...put it deep down)

- Khi đã xong, hãy ĐƯA RA CHỖ CÓ NẮNG VÀ TƯỚI NƯỚC (put it in a sunny place and water) hàng ngày.

- Cách chăm sóc này sẽ GIÚP KHOAI TÂY PHÁT TRIỂN (help the potato grow) trong vài tuần.

questions.content:
Topic: childhood

Đoạn văn của 4 người

A: As a child, I spent hours playing board games with my friends. The rules were pretty straightforward and easy to understand. As I grew older, I thought it would be a great chance for families to bond in this way. However, modern board games were much harder, with so many rules and characters to choose from. Although I did have a great time with my two sons and we often laughed while playing, it was still a bit of an effort to learn how to play.


B: I preferred to play outdoors with my friends when I was small. I was lucky. The weather where we lived was usually nice, so we often ran around and chased each other in the field. Sometimes, we lay on the grass and made funny faces. All of these memories were just wonderful, and they made me realize how much I enjoy being around people. Even today, I find it hard to stay home alone.


C: I wasn’t able to move much as a child, and even now. I mostly stayed at home since I don’t have many friends. I was drawn to books and preferred reading in my free time. There was a library I often visited, and I would get completely lost in the stories. Now, I don’t read as much as I used to, but I don’t go out very often either. Instead, I spend time on my computer, where I can play games. I prefer interactive ones because they let me socialize with people online.


D: I enjoyed playing outdoors. When the day was gloomy, as it often was, I looked out of my window and hoped it would stop. There wasn’t much I could do inside the house. My parents often gave me books, but I never liked sitting still and reading. Until one day, my mother brought me a box full of art supplies. That’s when I realized there was another thing I loved—painting. I could spend hours just staring at a blank canvas, wondering what to draw next.

tienphongSpace
questions.suggestion:
1. Who enjoyed playing games with their children? - Person A 

2. Who enjoyed playing with their friends as a child? - Person B

3. Who thought childhood games were much simpler? - Person A    

4. Who wished they could spend more time outdoors?  - Person D

5. Who enjoyed playing modern games?  - Person C   

6. Who enjoyed doing arts as a child? - Person D

7. Who enjoyed reading books as a child? - Person   C

questions.content:
1.Even before the nineteenth century, mountains had always been a magnet for travelers. They attracted people simply because of their natural beauty, and climbing to the summit to enjoy the view was one of the pleasures of adventurers. Today, although mountain peaks remain popular destinations, the meaning of climbing them has changed. Reaching the summit is no longer only about sightseeing but has become a symbol of success and achievement. For many, it represents a once-in-a-lifetime challenge that they want to accomplish in order to feel fulfilled, rather than just a scenic excursion.


2.For many climbers, reaching the top of a mountain carries a deeper meaning. The “summit” is often seen as a metaphor for success in life, while the obstacles faced during the climb are viewed as personal challenges. Over time, this act has developed into a cultural pursuit, where mountaineering is connected to adventure, risk, and self-affirmation. What climbers encounter or see along the route seems to matter less compared to the pride of standing at the peak. In this way, the journey itself is often overshadowed by the final accomplishment.


3.The idea of climbing as an “achievement” has become especially widespread with the rise of the so-called “summit selfie.” Even before social media, taking a photo at the top was considered one of the most important parts of the climb. At first, this was simply a way to preserve a memory, but later it became a means of sharing the experience with others. Social platforms have intensified this trend, as many people now care less about the journey itself and more about capturing a picture at the summit. For some, the climb is no longer about nature or exploration but about evidence of success to be seen by others.


4.The photograph captured by Ethan Crawford in 1993 exposed the unsettling reality of contemporary mountaineering. The image showed hundreds of people queuing in line to reach the mountain’s peak, something once reserved for true explorers. Instead of faces filled with determination and excitement, the photo revealed exhaustion and impatience. After being shared widely on social media, the image sparked a heated debate about whether climbing to the summit has lost its original meaning. Many began to question if the act is still about exploration or if it has been reduced to nothing more than a competitive display.


5.From this photograph, critics argue that reaching the summit remains a desirable goal for many, though often for different reasons. However, they suggest that people are ignoring the multifaceted nature of mountaineering. For some climbers, neither the journey nor the true experience of reaching the top seems to matter, since they are merely following a trend. In reality, climbing requires much more, including but not limited to physical preparation, financial planning, and logistical organization. Without these elements, the act of mountaineering becomes superficial rather than meaningful.


6.One major argument circulating online is that this trend-driven approach to climbing should come to an end. Popular mountains have been left with excessive amounts of waste, raising concerns about environmental damage. For this reason, activists stress that people should climb more responsibly. They contend that, regardless of personal goals, reaching the top is only worthwhile when the journey itself is a positive and respectful experience. Otherwise, the achievement loses its true value.


7.Perhaps it is time to change the way people think about mountaineering and return to its original spirit. In her memoir, Charlie Bennett once described how walking up a mountain allowed her to enjoy the landscape, slow down, and reconnect with nature. “For me, climbing was never about rivalry or recognition; it was about moving quietly, letting the mountain set the rhythm, and discovering joy in simply being present. Each step felt like an invitation to reflect, to connect with nature, and to find calm in the stillness of the journey. This is why I believe the true essence of mountaineering is not conquest, but appreciation — an experience that is both deeply personal and profoundly natural.”

tienphongSpace

tienphongSpace

A: This is my first time going to a concert. I didn’t feel very well during the first two days because it was raining and the music was just of average. It would have been much nicer if there had been some sunshine. Fortunately, the final day was wonderful, and I was able to meet my favorite singers and create unforgettable memories.


B: I attend music festivals every year. It has become a tradition for me, as I truly love the lively atmosphere filled with people and music. This festival, however, felt rather unusual. The weather was not ideal, but that didn’t really bother me, since I have been to rain-free festivals and still had fun. The location was only somewhat convenient, and the music was quite average. Honestly, I don’t think I will return in the future.


C: I don’t like one particular type of music being played at festivals. I prefer an album with a mix of genres to dance to, and this show really met my expectations. The melodies performed were simply astonishing. It did rain a little, but I didn’t mind at all; in fact, I felt it added to the lively atmosphere. However, I noticed that the ticket price was rather high, and not many students could afford it. Personally, I had to save money for months before attending.


D: My band and I were invited to play at this festival. We gave our usual performance and were able to create a memorable show. Some of our old members were there, along with artists we had collaborated with in the past. It was wonderful catching up with them after the event. Unfortunately, the venue was far from the main road, and transporting our equipment was quite difficult.

questions.questionTitle: Reading - Part 4 - Topic : The arrival of four-day week
questions.content:
1. With the emergence of the four-day working week, the traditional five-day schedule is increasingly being challenged. Many firms still cling to industrial-age models, assuming that long working hours guarantee efficiency. Yet, such assumptions no longer reflect the needs of modern employees. Today’s workforce values flexibility and wellbeing just as much as income. In fact, a rigid timetable often leads to burnout rather than productivity. It is becoming clear that the conventional system is steadily losing relevance.


2. The four-day working week has become highly relevant in today’s context of fast-paced living. The five-day system offers little time for proper rest or personal commitments. This is particularly demanding for women, who often balance professional duties with family responsibilities. A shorter schedule would allow employees to recharge and spend quality time with their loved ones. As a result, workers are more likely to be motivated and engaged in their jobs. In the long run, this can enhance both personal happiness and workplace morale.


3. Despite its advantages, many corporations remain sceptical of the four-day model. Employers often fear that fewer hours will inevitably reduce productivity and profitability. These concerns are not entirely groundless. For example, a British company that trialled the scheme reported a 30% fall in performance. In Stevension City, the introduction of this policy resulted in losses of around 30 million dollars within a single month. Such evidence makes some businesses wary of adopting the reform on a large scale.


4. At first glance, the four-day week appears to provide employees with greater freedom and better balance. Companies that have introduced the policy often report that work is still completed within the shorter timeframe. However, hidden drawbacks are starting to surface. Studies show that compressed hours can lead to more mistakes and higher stress levels. Workers sometimes take unfinished tasks home, undermining the very purpose of the reform. These challenges raise doubts about the long-term sustainability of the model.


5. Difficult to change entrenched habits

Psychological studies suggest that while the shorter week initially improves morale, the effect quickly fades. Employees often feel happier in the first stage because of the sudden increase in free time. Yet, after a period of adjustment, their emotional state tends to return to its normal level. Some even experience boredom or frustration once the novelty wears off. As a result, workers may start engaging in unpaid tasks or working from home to fill the gap. This pattern suggests that structural change alone may not guarantee lasting satisfaction.


6. Unfair for certain groups

Although the four-day week benefits many, certain professions find it far less practical. Teachers, for example, still have to cover the same amount of material and manage the same number of students. Compressing this workload into fewer days risks lowering educational quality. The police force faces similar obstacles, since crime does not decrease simply because officers are off duty. In such fields, reducing working days could lead to serious inefficiencies. Therefore, blanket application of the policy may create inequality across different sectors.


7. Alternative solutions worth considering

Rather than implementing a universal four-day week, organisations could consider more flexible alternatives. Options such as reducing daily working hours, offering longer paid leave, or increasing financial incentives might prove equally effective. These approaches allow employees to enjoy better balance without disrupting productivity. Furthermore, companies could invest in digital tools and training to improve efficiency. A gradual shift towards flexibility may reduce resistance from employers. Ultimately, a tailored strategy may offer greater benefits than a one-size-fits-all solution.



tienphongSpace

answerList.content: A way of life now outdated
CÓ THÊM 1 ĐÁP ÁN GÂY NHIỄU

questions.content:
Person A:

For me, the most important thing about extreme sports is preparation. Many people think it’s just about excitement and bravery, but I don’t agree. Without proper training, you can easily get injured or even cause accidents for other people. I once joined a rock-climbing course, and I spent weeks learning how to use the equipment safely. After that, the real climb was much more enjoyable because I felt confident. I believe training is not only useful but also makes the whole experience less stressful and more rewarding.


Person B:

I have always preferred traditional sports such as swimming and running because they keep me healthy without being too dangerous. Still, I wanted to know what an extreme sport would feel like, so last year I tried bungee jumping while on holiday. At first, I was extremely nervous, but when I finally jumped, the feeling was unforgettable. It gave me a thrill that swimming never could. Even so, I still practice swimming every week because it’s safer and more practical, but I admit that extreme sports can be fun if you try them at least once.


Person C:

Honestly, I don’t understand why people do extreme sports. They seem very risky and unnecessary to me. I have never tried one and I don’t plan to. Some of my friends invited me to join them for snowboarding and paragliding, but I always said no. It’s not that I don’t like sports—I enjoy cycling and tennis—but I don’t see the point of risking my health just to feel a few seconds of excitement. To me, extreme sports are not important for a happy life, and I avoid them whenever possible.


Person D:

What I really enjoy about extreme sports is that they often take place in nature. Last summer, I went kayaking on a wild river, and the scenery was breathtaking. I also tried mountain biking in the forest, and I loved the feeling of fresh air and freedom. It’s not just about the sport itself, but about being surrounded by mountains, trees, and water. I sometimes wish I had more free time and money so that I could join these activities more often. Extreme sports give me energy and help me feel connected to the natural world.

tienphongSpace
questions.suggestion:
1. Who thinks preparation is necessary before doing extreme sports? Person A

4. Who enjoys being outdoors when doing extreme sports? Person D 

5. Who wishes to do more extreme sports in the future? Person D 

6. Who believes extreme sports are not important? Person C 

7. Who always avoids extreme sports? Person C

Topic: Extreme sports


A: Before diving into any extreme sport, I truly believe it’s crucial to undergo proper training. While these activities can be thrilling, they also carry risks if you're not well-prepared. I've witnessed people injuring themselves simply because they didn't take the necessary precautions. That’s why I always make sure to complete a training program and familiarize myself with the safety guidelines before trying something new. With the right preparation, extreme sports can be an amazing experience.


B: I've always had a fondness for more traditional sports such as swimming, running, and tennis. They're enjoyable and easy to incorporate into a routine. However, a few months ago, I had the chance to go bungee jumping during a vacation, and it turned out to be an unforgettable experience. I didn’t anticipate having so much fun! While I still prefer regular sports for daily exercise, I now feel much more open to trying extreme sports occasionally for the thrill.


C: What I appreciate most about extreme sports is the unique way they allow me to connect with nature. Activities like rock climbing and mountain biking enable me to explore stunning landscapes while also pushing my physical and mental limits. It’s an escape from the everyday routine, and it makes me feel truly alive. If I had more time and resources, I would love to engage in these sports more frequently, particularly in wild, remote locations.


D: I understand that some people find extreme sports exhilarating, but they’ve never been significant to me. In fact, I try to avoid them whenever I can. I’m not fond of the idea of placing myself in risky situations just for the sake of excitement. There are many safer alternatives to staying active and enjoying life. I’d much rather take a peaceful walk or do some yoga than jump out of an airplane or scale a mountain. It’s simply not my cup of tea.

tienphongSpace

questions.questionTitle: Reading - Part 3 - Topic : Work and life balance
questions.content:
Topic Work and life balance

A: When I was a child, I enjoyed playing board games with my parents after their busy workdays. Now, I get to share that experience with my own kids, and having a four-day workweek gives us more time together. Flexible schedules are a big help, but I always make sure to plan ahead so I can balance both work and family life. These are the moments that create lasting memories.


B: As a kid, I would set up pretend offices with my friends, using toy phones and notebooks. I loved taking on the role of 'boss' and organizing our tasks. Those imaginative games taught me valuable lessons in organization and leadership, and I still laugh thinking about the 'serious' meetings we held.


C: When I was younger, I devoured books about different professions, dreaming about what my future career might be. Those books inspired my ambition. Today, I rely on productivity apps to keep track of my tasks in my four-day workweek. While the apps make my work more efficient, the excitement of organizing and planning is still the same.


D: As a child, I spent countless evenings playing tag with my friends in the neighborhood. On rainy days, though, I often found myself feeling bored indoors. Now, after work, I practice mindfulness to help me relax and recharge. It’s especially helpful with a shorter workweek, as it keeps me focused and refreshed.

tienphongSpace

questions.content:
Topic: childhood

Đoạn văn của 4 người

A: As a child, I spent hours playing board games with my friends. The rules were pretty straightforward and easy to understand. As I grew older, I thought it would be a great chance for families to bond in this way. However, modern board games were much harder, with so many rules and characters to choose from. Although I did have a great time with my two sons and we often laughed while playing, it was still a bit of an effort to learn how to play.


B: I preferred to play outdoors with my friends when I was small. I was lucky. The weather where we lived was usually nice, so we often ran around and chased each other in the field. Sometimes, we lay on the grass and made funny faces. All of these memories were just wonderful, and they made me realize how much I enjoy being around people. Even today, I find it hard to stay home alone.


C: I wasn’t able to move much as a child, and even now. I mostly stayed at home since I don’t have many friends. I was drawn to books and preferred reading in my free time. There was a library I often visited, and I would get completely lost in the stories. Now, I don’t read as much as I used to, but I don’t go out very often either. Instead, I spend time on my computer, where I can play games. I prefer interactive ones because they let me socialize with people online.


D: I enjoyed playing outdoors. When the day was gloomy, as it often was, I looked out of my window and hoped it would stop. There wasn’t much I could do inside the house. My parents often gave me books, but I never liked sitting still and reading. Until one day, my mother brought me a box full of art supplies. That’s when I realized there was another thing I loved—painting. I could spend hours just staring at a blank canvas, wondering what to draw next.

tienphongSpace
questions.suggestion:
1. Who enjoyed playing games with their children? - Person A 

2. Who enjoyed playing with their friends as a child? - Person B

3. Who thought childhood games were much simpler? - Person A    

4. Who wished they could spend more time outdoors?  - Person D

5. Who enjoyed playing modern games?  - Person C   

6. Who enjoyed doing arts as a child? - Person D

7. Who enjoyed reading books as a child? - Person   C

questions.content:
Four people respond in the comments section of an online magazine article about a Music festival. Read the texts and then answer the questions below.


tienphongSpace

A: This is my first time going to a concert. I didn’t feel very well during the first two days because it was raining and the music was just of average. It would have been much nicer if there had been some sunshine. Fortunately, the final day was wonderful, and I was able to meet my favorite singers and create unforgettable memories.


B: I attend music festivals every year. It has become a tradition for me, as I truly love the lively atmosphere filled with people and music. This festival, however, felt rather unusual. The weather was not ideal, but that didn’t really bother me, since I have been to rain-free festivals and still had fun. The location was only somewhat convenient, and the music was quite average. Honestly, I don’t think I will return in the future.


C: I don’t like one particular type of music being played at festivals. I prefer an album with a mix of genres to dance to, and this show really met my expectations. The melodies performed were simply astonishing. It did rain a little, but I didn’t mind at all; in fact, I felt it added to the lively atmosphere. However, I noticed that the ticket price was rather high, and not many students could afford it. Personally, I had to save money for months before attending.


D: My band and I were invited to play at this festival. We gave our usual performance and were able to create a memorable show. Some of our old members were there, along with artists we had collaborated with in the past. It was wonderful catching up with them after the event. Unfortunately, the venue was far from the main road, and transporting our equipment was quite difficult.

questions.content:
Topic : Career 

A: When I finished school, some people told me that I should get a job immediately. However, I wanted to gain some hands-on experience first. That’s why I applied for several volunteering positions. Even though I didn’t receive any financial benefits, I was able to work in different fields. Looking back, I don’t regret my choice at all because of all the knowledge I gained.


B: I went straight to university aafter I graduated from high school. I have always wanted to become a teacher, so it was pointless to try any other professions. Three months ago, I went on an internship at a local school. It was definitely a mind-changing experience, though the workload was a bit more than I expected. Still, I would say it was very valuable.  


C: As a child, I lived near a plumber and worked with her. She gave me simple tasks like checking for any pipe leaks or securing the nails with a screw. It was natural for me later on to go to university to become an electrician, as I wanted to study something practical. Now that I know they provide compact electrical courses online, I wish I had enrolled in them instead.


D: After school, I wanted some time to figure out what I wanted to do. Therefore, I searched for temporary positions. However, it wasn’t easy to reach a deal because companies didn’t want someone with no prior experience. In the end, a game company reached out to me and I agreed to work with them. It was a hybrid position, so sometimes I worked late in the evenings, but it didn’t cause any problems for me.

questions.content:
Topic: Extreme sports


A: Before diving into any extreme sport, I truly believe it’s crucial to undergo proper training. While these activities can be thrilling, they also carry risks if you're not well-prepared. I've witnessed people injuring themselves simply because they didn't take the necessary precautions. That’s why I always make sure to complete a training program and familiarize myself with the safety guidelines before trying something new. With the right preparation, extreme sports can be an amazing experience.


B: I've always had a fondness for more traditional sports such as swimming, running, and tennis. They're enjoyable and easy to incorporate into a routine. However, a few months ago, I had the chance to go bungee jumping during a vacation, and it turned out to be an unforgettable experience. I didn’t anticipate having so much fun! While I still prefer regular sports for daily exercise, I now feel much more open to trying extreme sports occasionally for the thrill.


C: What I appreciate most about extreme sports is the unique way they allow me to connect with nature. Activities like rock climbing and mountain biking enable me to explore stunning landscapes while also pushing my physical and mental limits. It’s an escape from the everyday routine, and it makes me feel truly alive. If I had more time and resources, I would love to engage in these sports more frequently, particularly in wild, remote locations.


D: I understand that some people find extreme sports exhilarating, but they’ve never been significant to me. In fact, I try to avoid them whenever I can. I’m not fond of the idea of placing myself in risky situations just for the sake of excitement. There are many safer alternatives to staying active and enjoying life. I’d much rather take a peaceful walk or do some yoga than jump out of an airplane or scale a mountain. It’s simply not my cup of tea.

questions.questionTitle: Reading - Part 3 - Topic : Work and life balance
questions.content:
Topic Work and life balance

A: When I was a child, I enjoyed playing board games with my parents after their busy workdays. Now, I get to share that experience with my own kids, and having a four-day workweek gives us more time together. Flexible schedules are a big help, but I always make sure to plan ahead so I can balance both work and family life. These are the moments that create lasting memories.


B: As a kid, I would set up pretend offices with my friends, using toy phones and notebooks. I loved taking on the role of 'boss' and organizing our tasks. Those imaginative games taught me valuable lessons in organization and leadership, and I still laugh thinking about the 'serious' meetings we held.


C: When I was younger, I devoured books about different professions, dreaming about what my future career might be. Those books inspired my ambition. Today, I rely on productivity apps to keep track of my tasks in my four-day workweek. While the apps make my work more efficient, the excitement of organizing and planning is still the same.


D: As a child, I spent countless evenings playing tag with my friends in the neighborhood. On rainy days, though, I often found myself feeling bored indoors. Now, after work, I practice mindfulness to help me relax and recharge. It’s especially helpful with a shorter workweek, as it keeps me focused and refreshed.

questions.content:
Person A:

For me, the most important thing about extreme sports is preparation. Many people think it’s just about excitement and bravery, but I don’t agree. Without proper training, you can easily get injured or even cause accidents for other people. I once joined a rock-climbing course, and I spent weeks learning how to use the equipment safely. After that, the real climb was much more enjoyable because I felt confident. I believe training is not only useful but also makes the whole experience less stressful and more rewarding.


Person B:

I have always preferred traditional sports such as swimming and running because they keep me healthy without being too dangerous. Still, I wanted to know what an extreme sport would feel like, so last year I tried bungee jumping while on holiday. At first, I was extremely nervous, but when I finally jumped, the feeling was unforgettable. It gave me a thrill that swimming never could. Even so, I still practice swimming every week because it’s safer and more practical, but I admit that extreme sports can be fun if you try them at least once.


Person C:

Honestly, I don’t understand why people do extreme sports. They seem very risky and unnecessary to me. I have never tried one and I don’t plan to. Some of my friends invited me to join them for snowboarding and paragliding, but I always said no. It’s not that I don’t like sports—I enjoy cycling and tennis—but I don’t see the point of risking my health just to feel a few seconds of excitement. To me, extreme sports are not important for a happy life, and I avoid them whenever possible.


Person D:

What I really enjoy about extreme sports is that they often take place in nature. Last summer, I went kayaking on a wild river, and the scenery was breathtaking. I also tried mountain biking in the forest, and I loved the feeling of fresh air and freedom. It’s not just about the sport itself, but about being surrounded by mountains, trees, and water. I sometimes wish I had more free time and money so that I could join these activities more often. Extreme sports give me energy and help me feel connected to the natural world.

questions.content:
1.Even before the nineteenth century, mountains had always been a magnet for travelers. They attracted people simply because of their natural beauty, and climbing to the summit to enjoy the view was one of the pleasures of adventurers. Today, although mountain peaks remain popular destinations, the meaning of climbing them has changed. Reaching the summit is no longer only about sightseeing but has become a symbol of success and achievement. For many, it represents a once-in-a-lifetime challenge that they want to accomplish in order to feel fulfilled, rather than just a scenic excursion.


2.For many climbers, reaching the top of a mountain carries a deeper meaning. The “summit” is often seen as a metaphor for success in life, while the obstacles faced during the climb are viewed as personal challenges. Over time, this act has developed into a cultural pursuit, where mountaineering is connected to adventure, risk, and self-affirmation. What climbers encounter or see along the route seems to matter less compared to the pride of standing at the peak. In this way, the journey itself is often overshadowed by the final accomplishment.


3.The idea of climbing as an “achievement” has become especially widespread with the rise of the so-called “summit selfie.” Even before social media, taking a photo at the top was considered one of the most important parts of the climb. At first, this was simply a way to preserve a memory, but later it became a means of sharing the experience with others. Social platforms have intensified this trend, as many people now care less about the journey itself and more about capturing a picture at the summit. For some, the climb is no longer about nature or exploration but about evidence of success to be seen by others.


4.The photograph captured by Ethan Crawford in 1993 exposed the unsettling reality of contemporary mountaineering. The image showed hundreds of people queuing in line to reach the mountain’s peak, something once reserved for true explorers. Instead of faces filled with determination and excitement, the photo revealed exhaustion and impatience. After being shared widely on social media, the image sparked a heated debate about whether climbing to the summit has lost its original meaning. Many began to question if the act is still about exploration or if it has been reduced to nothing more than a competitive display.


5.From this photograph, critics argue that reaching the summit remains a desirable goal for many, though often for different reasons. However, they suggest that people are ignoring the multifaceted nature of mountaineering. For some climbers, neither the journey nor the true experience of reaching the top seems to matter, since they are merely following a trend. In reality, climbing requires much more, including but not limited to physical preparation, financial planning, and logistical organization. Without these elements, the act of mountaineering becomes superficial rather than meaningful.


6.One major argument circulating online is that this trend-driven approach to climbing should come to an end. Popular mountains have been left with excessive amounts of waste, raising concerns about environmental damage. For this reason, activists stress that people should climb more responsibly. They contend that, regardless of personal goals, reaching the top is only worthwhile when the journey itself is a positive and respectful experience. Otherwise, the achievement loses its true value.


7.Perhaps it is time to change the way people think about mountaineering and return to its original spirit. In her memoir, Charlie Bennett once described how walking up a mountain allowed her to enjoy the landscape, slow down, and reconnect with nature. “For me, climbing was never about rivalry or recognition; it was about moving quietly, letting the mountain set the rhythm, and discovering joy in simply being present. Each step felt like an invitation to reflect, to connect with nature, and to find calm in the stillness of the journey. This is why I believe the true essence of mountaineering is not conquest, but appreciation — an experience that is both deeply personal and profoundly natural.”

questions.questionTitle: Reading - Part 4 - Topic : The arrival of four-day week
questions.content:
1. With the emergence of the four-day working week, the traditional five-day schedule is increasingly being challenged. Many firms still cling to industrial-age models, assuming that long working hours guarantee efficiency. Yet, such assumptions no longer reflect the needs of modern employees. Today’s workforce values flexibility and wellbeing just as much as income. In fact, a rigid timetable often leads to burnout rather than productivity. It is becoming clear that the conventional system is steadily losing relevance.


2. The four-day working week has become highly relevant in today’s context of fast-paced living. The five-day system offers little time for proper rest or personal commitments. This is particularly demanding for women, who often balance professional duties with family responsibilities. A shorter schedule would allow employees to recharge and spend quality time with their loved ones. As a result, workers are more likely to be motivated and engaged in their jobs. In the long run, this can enhance both personal happiness and workplace morale.


3. Despite its advantages, many corporations remain sceptical of the four-day model. Employers often fear that fewer hours will inevitably reduce productivity and profitability. These concerns are not entirely groundless. For example, a British company that trialled the scheme reported a 30% fall in performance. In Stevension City, the introduction of this policy resulted in losses of around 30 million dollars within a single month. Such evidence makes some businesses wary of adopting the reform on a large scale.


4. At first glance, the four-day week appears to provide employees with greater freedom and better balance. Companies that have introduced the policy often report that work is still completed within the shorter timeframe. However, hidden drawbacks are starting to surface. Studies show that compressed hours can lead to more mistakes and higher stress levels. Workers sometimes take unfinished tasks home, undermining the very purpose of the reform. These challenges raise doubts about the long-term sustainability of the model.


5. Difficult to change entrenched habits

Psychological studies suggest that while the shorter week initially improves morale, the effect quickly fades. Employees often feel happier in the first stage because of the sudden increase in free time. Yet, after a period of adjustment, their emotional state tends to return to its normal level. Some even experience boredom or frustration once the novelty wears off. As a result, workers may start engaging in unpaid tasks or working from home to fill the gap. This pattern suggests that structural change alone may not guarantee lasting satisfaction.


6. Unfair for certain groups

Although the four-day week benefits many, certain professions find it far less practical. Teachers, for example, still have to cover the same amount of material and manage the same number of students. Compressing this workload into fewer days risks lowering educational quality. The police force faces similar obstacles, since crime does not decrease simply because officers are off duty. In such fields, reducing working days could lead to serious inefficiencies. Therefore, blanket application of the policy may create inequality across different sectors.


7. Alternative solutions worth considering

Rather than implementing a universal four-day week, organisations could consider more flexible alternatives. Options such as reducing daily working hours, offering longer paid leave, or increasing financial incentives might prove equally effective. These approaches allow employees to enjoy better balance without disrupting productivity. Furthermore, companies could invest in digital tools and training to improve efficiency. A gradual shift towards flexibility may reduce resistance from employers. Ultimately, a tailored strategy may offer greater benefits than a one-size-fits-all solution.



tienphongSpace
